subtitle: hi my name is Michaela Ezra I am from
Sydney Australia but during my 15 years
in New York I had the incredible
blessing and privilege of coming across
the meaningful Life Center and the work
of Rabbi Jacobson
I had a traditional beautiful Jewish
upbringing in a loving home
I went to a modern Orthodox day school
and I had like a real inbuilt love for
for our heritage I didn't realize
anything was missing but I was seeking
and on the recommendation of a friend I
went to one of Rabbi Jacobson's lectures
on the upper west side back in 2007.
and I don't even remember what he said
I just know that his words touch my
heart because during that time it was
though a light went off inside of me and
I felt like this is the Judaism that
I've been missing that I didn't even
know I needed
and that just sparked something I then
immersed myself in his book towards a
meaningful life and and the website and
so many other platforms of teaching
and they have truly shifted and shaped
my experience not only of Judaism but
really of Life all of these mystical
teachings from hasi do it to the Tanya
and the spheroid it's as though they
were flying off the page and into my
heart
Rabbi Jacobson has this
incredibly unique and
innate sensitivity to The Human
Condition to our spirit to our trials
and tribulations
and
in his writing and in his work he really
demonstrates how the Torah is this
incredible gift that allows us to
navigate all of those experiences it's
really the Judaism for the modern age in
the way that he is able to weave
together ancient wisdom with our
current
emotional spiritual and psychological
realities and needs and it's a beautiful
beautiful gift
what I really appreciate is Rabbi
Jacobson's incredible optimism no matter
what you read or listen to
you walk away with this feeling of
hopefulness you know that he sees the
goodness in every single human being and
he really has faith and and shares that
faith not only in Hashem but also in
each one of us and our ability to step
up and
and do what we're meant to do in this
lifetime he he really channels that
belief in every word that he speaks and
you walk away feeling uplifted and
motivated I'm very proud very proud
really seeking to learn more seeking to
do more I know that for me it has
completely this learning has completely
shaped the way I speak to my children
it's shaped the values that I would like
my family to experience and to share and
shape the home that I would like to
create that I am creating it's shaped
the work that I want to do and am doing
in the world
and I just really pray and hope that
through this campaign
these teachings are able to do to others
what they did for me to touch many many
hearts around the world and
[Music]
